title: 106_s630
content: TRANSFER OF RESPONSIBILITY FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE FLATHEAD IRRIGATION PROJECT, MONTANA. The purpose of this Act is to preserve family farms and ranches in the Jocko Valley, Camas Valley, and Mission Valley, Montana by transferring responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project without affecting water rights negotiations. Definitions include terms like "contract," "irrigation district," and "project." The Flathead Irrigation Project, authorized by Acts in 1904 and 1908, involves the Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes. The Secretary of the Interior is defined as the "Secretary." A contract will be offered to the irrigation district within a year to manage the project, including rights and powers held by the Secretary. The contract for the Flathead Irrigation Project will include provisions to identify trust responsibilities of the United States to the Tribe, maintain instream flows for fisheries, and continue obligations for project construction costs. The contract for the Flathead Irrigation Project will include provisions to identify trust responsibilities of the United States to the Tribe, maintain instream flows for fisheries, and continue obligations for project construction costs. The enactment of this Act governs the repayment of construction costs, with provisions for an accelerated payment, amendment of repayment contracts, and revocation of the contract if the irrigation district operates the project improperly. The Flathead Irrigation Project contract includes provisions to protect tribal trust assets. Operation of the project must adhere to Bureau of Indian Affairs plan of operations to prevent damage to these assets. Changes in operation due to new information or decisions are allowed as long as the irrigation district complies. The Secretary will negotiate with the irrigation district to enter into a contract within 1 year. The contract will transfer ownership of equipment and supplies purchased with operation and maintenance funds to the irrigation district, except for real property. The Secretary will negotiate a contract with the irrigation district within 1 year to transfer ownership of equipment and supplies, excluding real property and water rights. This Act does not impact water rights negotiations between Montana, the United States, and the Tribe.
